Detailed Description

The Transaction class atomically commits or rolls back changes made to a database through a specific connection and releases any locks held by that connection. A transaction must be committed to preserve changes or share changes with other concurrent connections.

Start a transaction with begin(). After accessing or modifying the database, complete the transaction with commit() or rollback(). If the transaction is still active when this object is destroyed, it is rolled back automatically.

{
::storage::ittiadb::Transaction transaction(connection);
transaction.begin();
// ... select, insert, update, delete, etc. ...
if (successful) {
transaction.commit();
}
}
storage::ittiadb::Transaction
The Transaction class atomically commits or rolls back changes made to a database through a specific ...
Definition: transaction.h:64

Database operations that require a transaction will implicitly start a transaction if one is not already active. In this case, it is not necessary to call begin() before committing or rolling back the transaction.

// ... select, insert, update, delete, etc. ...
::storage::ittiadb::Transaction(connection).commit();
storage::ittiadb::Transaction::commit
db_result_t commit(db_flags_t flags=0)
Commit a database's active transaction.
Definition: transaction.h:324
Note
this object must be destroyed before the connection is closed.

enum storage::ittiadb::Transaction::IsolationLevel

An enum Isolation Level.

Enumerator
ReadCommitted 

Read committed isolation.

RepeatableRead 

Repeatable read isolation.

Serializable 

Serializable isolation.

◆ LockMode

enum storage::ittiadb::Transaction::LockMode

An enum Lock mode.

Enumerator
Shared 

Share access to database with other transaction. This function will wait for transactions with an exclusive lock to finish.

Exclusive 

Obtain exclusive access to the database for duration of this transaction.This function willwait for all other transaction to finish.

◆ CompletionMode

enum storage::ittiadb::Transaction::CompletionMode

An enum completion mode.

Enumerator
LazyCompletion 

Lazy completion.

ForcedCompletion 

Immediate completion.

GroupCompletion 

Group completion.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Transaction()

storage::ittiadb::Transaction::Transaction ( Connection &  connection)
inlineexplicit

Create a transaction on a database connection.

Parameters
connectionA database connection object. The connection must be opened before any member functions can be used.
Note
The Transaction object must be destroyed before connection.

Member Function Documentation

◆ begin() [1/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Transaction::begin ( db_flags_t  flags = 0)
inline

Begin a transaction.

Parameters
flagsTransaction begin flags
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, invalid flags parameter, invalid lock mode, invalid isolation mode
    • DB_ETXACTIVE A transaction already running. Call commit() or
      rollback() to finish the previous transaction before
      starting a new transaction. To continue using the previous transaction, ignore this error.
    • DB_ENOTX No such transaction found.

      rollback() to finish the previous transaction before
      starting a new transaction. To continue using the previous transaction, ignore this error.

◆ begin() [3/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Transaction::begin ( LockMode  lock_mode)
inline

Begin a transaction.

Parameters
lock_modeLock mode
  • Shared Share access to database with other transaction. This function will wait for transactions with an exclusive lock to finish
  • Exclusive Obtain exclusive access to the database for duration of this transaction. This function willwait for all other transaction to finish.
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, invalid flags parameter, invalid lock mode, invalid isolation mode
    • DB_ETXACTIVE A transaction already running. Call commit() or rollback() to finish the previous transaction before
      starting a new transaction. To continue using the previous transaction, ignore this error.
    • DB_ENOTX No such transaction found.

◆ rollback() [1/2]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Transaction::rollback ( db_flags_t  flags = 0)
inline

Rollbacks database's active transaction.

Parameters
flagsTransaction rollback flags
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, invalid flags parameter, invalid lock mode, invalid isolation mode
    • DB_ENOTX No such transaction found.
    • DB_ESTATE Object name is not compatible with the method called or argument. This could be caused by invalid transaction state.

inline

Parameters

  • ForcedCompletion Immediate completion.
  • GroupCompletion Group completion.
Returns

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, invalid flags parameter, invalid lock mode, invalid isolation mode
    • DB_ENOTX No such transaction found.
    • DB_ESTATE Object name is not compatible with the method called or argument. This could be caused by invalid transaction state.

◆ isActive()

bool storage::ittiadb::Transaction::isActive ( ) const
inline

Determine whether a transaction is active.

Returns
  • true if a transaction is active.
  • false if no transaction is active.
  • asserts on failure.
